intro: Plagiobothrys glaber, commonly known as the smooth bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and pungent odor. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its smooth, hairless stems and leaves are adapted to arid conditions, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds. Plagiobothrys glaber is often found in California and is of interest to botanists due to its ecological and evolutionary significance.
